        <common_name>RED DOT SUGARCANE DISEASE</common_name>
        <description>Red rot is a major disease in sugarcane that can cause severe loss to production and productivity. To manage the disease, sugarcane breeders screen for disease resistance to develop high yielding varieties.

The host of red rot disease in sugarcane is the sugarcane plant. Red rot is a serious disease caused by the fungus Colletotrichum falcatum (Glomerella tucumanensis). Symptoms of red rot include: 
Stems: Large red blotches on the outside and internal red rots with white patches 
Leaves: Small red oval spots on the midrib and upper surface of the leaf 
Smell: A sour alcoholic odor when the cane is split open 
Plants: Wilt and shrivel, and there is a reduction of sucrose content 
</description>
        <family/>
        <host/>
        <number>PLD0001121</number>
        <scientific_name>Colletotrichum falcatum</scientific_name>
        <solution>Treatment for Red Spots on Skin
Topical Medications: Corticosteroid creams or ointments to diminish inflammation and itching. Antifungal creams or powders for fungal infections. Antihistamines or calamine lotion for insect bites or allergic reactions.</solution>
